data.title: Equatorial Guinea
data.meta_description: Join us on our passport project and learn all about the amazing countries and places that exist. Today, we will learn about Equatorial Guinea.
data.meta_site_name: Art Sphere Inc. | Transforming Lives Through The Arts
data.text:
Equatorial Guinea is a country diverse in cultural composition and is made up of Rio Muni as well as five other islands, even though it is the smallest African country to be a member of the United Nations.

Equatorial Guinea is one of the richest countries in Africa because they are one of the largest oil producers in Africa.

Equatorial Guinea is located in southern africa, with a population of 1.309 million people. Its capital is Malabo, and the currency is Central African CFA franc (XAF), and the official languages in Equatorial Guinea are Portuguese, Spanish, and French.

It has no world heritage sites but has three national parks:

Altos de Nsork National Park

Monte Alén National Park

Pico Basilé National Park

Want to learn more about Angola? Click here to visit the tourism website.

Also check out Museum of Modern Art Equatorial Guinea.
